4BAB52C21F3B4BFC8EE72FB9CE22996C.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

1CC01D599165409AA77918B3C49FD7F9.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

C5FBD21978A941558BFF61D7F212504F.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

91CD447786B84097A04829DB85493C0A.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

25343AFF91874830AB2694557E47634A.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

F3B39311200447748BB8984D7C91E14F.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

1DBBB4BEAC624567A9336E8A4B2FC06C.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety and networking observed during the work placement.

2690D9C4D70B4327AB2D8789B77263DA.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

AB6F7F590E5F4D608D135B9ACB3D7795.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

BE81134CD7DC4E299F6E8AFF2F45FFE4.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

F09EBE6D57524832A5A77750B354ADF8.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

4E2C0EFDCBAD4210AADD2E83A00DFFB8.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

F4222CA9B7664FB89D2BACEFC674E005.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

C5E13B8B7D844562A2788BAF10245B24.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

F346E104C8FB4E93BF2B87B28AEE3C03.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

75D3D08A397F48B2A476DD6870390F86.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

8CBD4ACB9DAE4C16B65C448A98C7EE0C.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

7ADBEBE4A1AA42D787CAADD8DA927558.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

125C6D6281B74909BA6CDB4DD0FDD275.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

BC32D21742434AC7AC29E628F351BFE9.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

97060F45338D4E75A4B5F9899CFD66A5.description: Provide feedback on own and/or peer business plans

B946C975CF994829A0EEFCF8550506CB.description: Outline and present a plan for a small business in the hairstyling and esthetics industry in one’s community.

3614F6C0762B4F88A01B6F9A878A4F8D.description: Examine the importance of sustainable business practices such as providing good quality customer service, following environmental guidelines and employing qualified and certified personnel.

F462CB29C0004E8386966248FCBBE4E9.description: Research the requirements (e.g., registering for collecting and remitting taxes, licensing, zoning, obtaining any relevant permits and registering the business name) for establishing a small business in one’s community.

A8CEA6D64E63492AA369D12879636D11.description: Discuss common characteristics and qualifications of a successful small business owner in the hairstyling or esthetics industry.

980FD090E70A479F9A8867A8B6B9648D.description: Classify examples of hairstyling and esthetics within one’s community as home-based, sole proprietorship, partnership and/or franchise businesses.

6ACFC7D3FB38463CACDF3ABADC546166.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of owning a sole proprietorship, partnership and/or franchise business.

062001614E2B4987890DC3F180AD5128.description: Assess the importance of legislation and/or regulations (e.g., sanitization) that govern the beauty industry in Saskatchewan.

1320AED93A03468A8AF78A2E147D7397.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of operating a small business, including a home-based business.

5E6BD1A810B34499A9CC0304E3C69D81.description: Identify the contributions that small businesses make to the local and Saskatchewan economy.

AB70CA576C5B4C02837656343CE85130.description: Investigate small businesses, including home-based businesses, in the hairstyling and esthetics industry in Saskatchewan.

3B05EA306AE34411B6E1328E5412481F.description: Apply knowledge of anatomy and physiology to modify or change client services based on recognizing conditions, disorders or diseases.

60953127D5364197ACE5B0E5F14F0224.description: Discuss how a basic understanding of organs, structures, body systems and their function can assist decision making related to performing or adjusting salon services including aiding in design considerations, product choice and product application to achieve best results.

269B2C735E80430C959F72A2E6A29CB5.description: Recognize how knowledge and function of bones, muscles and nerves can prevent work place injury and increase ergonomic awareness.

D384C63CF6954724961EBDD96AF83BD9.description: Explain the major function of the integumentary system.

2BB7E4802FBC4B2B88563D1222D9DC45.description: Explain how blood is supplied to the body including arm, hand, foot and leg.

1220CD30A4714782B5CD297124701DB5.description: Describe and identify the nerves, including sensory and motor, of the arm, wrist, hand, fingers, ankle, foot, leg and face.

1A836FDF52624A678C3751935D86661E.description: Explain the function of the skin.

45B0934EC28646AA905F66928628085D.description: Describe and identify the bone structure and muscles of the arm, wrist, hand, fingers, ankle, foot, leg and face.

71065EB06FF24E128197B6F7B6885570.description: List and describe the functions of the 10 body systems (i.e., skeletal, muscular, nervous, circulatory (vascular), endocrine, excretory, digestive, respiratory, reproductive and integumentary).

188FF8027DEF4FD094A9D2C5365F6AFF.description: Recognize that a disease often affects more than one single body system.

CACB8C5D76D74BA8A12C03D38E1120B3.description: Explain the interrelationships of anatomy, physiology and histology as it applies to hairstyling and esthetics occupations including how technicians can use it to contribute to clients’ health and wellbeing.

8741990B74B74F808BDF5347654922AD.description: Discuss the relationship between anatomy, physiology and histology.

0B0C2005C25841B38219ACBF92EC359F.description: Define the terms anatomy, physiology and histology.

AEEF707506C84908B85A454E54B335A6.description: Examine anatomy and physiology as it applies to hairstyling and esthetics.

B4096187279F4B39A82E6CB56AB9E8DF.description: Describe own decision making and problem-solving processes used during competition and reflect on the effectiveness of choices made.

5417CBB772CF41569F77F0C97B018022.description: Interpret and apply competition scope document and rules and regulations.

2E5FA0F0D13946E3B2CE65F9DC319CC5.description: Compare competition test posted on Skills Canada website to judging criteria.

601729BDB2BB48879E7541D9F8E4437C.description: Produce competitive design(s) within a set of regulated guidelines and within the required timeline.

0CC2A76144224081AED91F5F5CFC43CE.description: Apply chemical waving terms, design, techniques, tools, preparation, procedure and safety within a time line and/or specific criteria.

0DC7C28B01014E8BACB7E9D9BE4B241D.description: Implement a combination of advanced styling and cutting terms, design elements, use of tools, equipment, product and safety within a time line and/or specific guideline.

5C92E6AE0B6E4D5B97D0135ABCA27B6A.description: Apply colouring terms, techniques, varied tools, equipment, product and safety within a time line and/or specified guideline.

F181D71A353A40348E3953346FAA9E03.description: Practise using long hairstyling advanced design terms, techniques, varied tools, equipment, product and safety within a timeline and/or specific criteria.

5D9E6946DA9B46D285285699DE7A837F.description: Recognize safe and sanitary practices throughout hairstyling competition.

676A0AD3329F460B97DB804070F0B3E9.description: Create advanced competitive hair designs based on an analysis of qualities and criteria required to be successful in competition.

D7454BE9DB104358824AE42D39AD36E4.description: Conduct an inquiry into the question, why are specialized tools and techniques necessary for performing facial hair trims?

212FA2EBB8884CBFB50DB29343FCC3F0.description: Examine and apply appropriate safety and sanitation practices for beard, mustache and facial services.

478F3BCFA424440D8464265D03B046ED.description: Discuss the option of using changeable blades and guards.

71EBB46B335647C38931D7E418A546CA.description: Analyze different skin sensitivities and conditions that impact facial grooming.

A2B0507389C04826B8A6D05BC2617A58.description: Demonstrate trimming of facial hair using a variety of tools such as scissors over comb, clipper and razors.

ED77F3D315B74712A9934BF32468FCE2.description: Distinguish growth patterns of facial hair.

0C4D682F7CF14FF28EDD0E3DADB911BF.description: Identify tools used in beard and mustache trims such as scissors, razors, clippers and guards.

B41C95C5D7AB4CFDAEB0B00EF76B5A2C.description: Research and discuss current trends and styles for facial hair.

2BD61EF28C9540C28E292AA596950C26.description: Analyze and apply beard, mustache and facial grooming techniques.

5038D2BBA1C54C2E9F51B676BB0C6CB8.description: Observe preparation, procedure and removal of permanent hair extension service.

FD3D3CDB558B470F8F7A8B6BA9C772C8.description: Explain how to modify or colour hair extensions to blend with natural hair.

0A78E9C9D9B4498DBAA394455055FA99.description: Describe how to condition, style, clean and repair wigs, hairpieces and hair extensions.

1D5EAD0E5A624017BD662EFC890A5965.description: Differentiate between real human hair and synthetic hair.

00647360ECAE4245A10B7482EF79A058.description: Investigate hair extensions and artificial hair including modifications.

44BEFEC41A0F4BF78F494691174F9593.description: Discuss and apply sanitation, disinfection and sterilization practices including use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and appropriate hygiene.

22195A8246974FFF9D472B6AF5CF397F.description: Analyze different hair colour application techniques.

2A87A3AC38FD4A758A6C446B4F4BDD6A.description: Describe how hair texture (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern) and hair characteristics (e.g., elasticity and porosity) impact a hair colouring service.

F98B4712AADE4F0ABC1B8362443E5DEF.description: Explain colour theory as it applies to hair colouring.

15CD1DC6B6F244E1882421B5F6CDCA66.description: Analyze advanced and complex colour services.

EC84785F5CB040978AC9622A3B47579F.description: Discuss how protective cream is applied for client safety, including proper hair sectioning and how tools are selected according to desired results.

BEA8EB4639194CAD8037C117C49806EB.description: Explain proper home after care steps for maintaining reduced curl.

67AE3B12A9B8496680DEDCA0EA8683BD.description: Compare the pH of different products and systems.

28157E2E56654D008DC685E9C6883454.description: Discuss potential hydrogen (pH) scale in relation to relaxer and straightening services.

7082CFAE02D349B296D70EE71A8A4105.description: Conduct an inquiry into the question, why do we need to know the different types of curl reducing products before starting the physical service?

5A5C753C34D74A5C9BA9A8CA46778A14.description: Demonstrate mock services using conditioner as mock relaxer.

CB057C9271064701BEC766BD48A636BC.description: Discuss how hair texture (i.e., kinky, curl pattern or coil configurations) impacts or changes the steps required to reduce curl.

576FBB5C88594F63BBB554659BB20B9A.description: Analyze hair texture (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern), hair characteristics (e.g., growth pattern, elasticity, porosity, density) and discuss which product would be most appropriate to reduce existing curl considering manufacturers’ specification and directions.

BF12B4BF30CA43F3A17F59BA16133810.description: Execute client consultation, pre-service procedures, draping for wet service and chemical service and shampoo and rinse procedure.

46CF6374C2654609A0E3B684AB4C97FE.description: Review hairstyling fundamentals (e.g., porosity and elasticity tests, sections, sub-sections, bases, tool measurement and tool position).

0CD0DE7B41724625ACF5A5739AC979C9.description: Investigate types of tools used to chemically restructure hair to reduce curl and texture hair.

1EB8A3C43AF0479EA5D3D3A36648EACD.description: Identify and explain how chemical relaxers work on hair including applicable trends and styles.

99AA7512FBD3471F809B1918A381B594.description: Explore chemical restructuring products and services used to reduce curls.

6D3F4E345E8B437982B447F4E8EC38DA.description: Conduct an inquiry into the question, how are chemical bond(s) in hair affected by the varied chemical and styling services?

4D97A9C2546B4762A188487789D5F0B1.description: Execute post-service steps for client service.

45152E37C50240848BCD8AD14D09C136.description: Discuss and demonstrate finishing services such as haircut and thermal styling.

30819661791346799B6C210049CADF28.description: Perform the chemical restructuring phase of a perm service using a mannequin.

1CCD56ED750A43A9AD3AF617D7586E26.description: Demonstrate ability to follow instruction and maintain safe and productive work environment.

7A644A341B3A41B1AC557D47E9991FAF.description: Determine desired perm and finished style through client consultation.

EA55E0389F08450CB4B2EBE5EC999D19.description: Summarize best practices for safe handling, storage, recycling and disposal of waste.

5742F022415943A8B37AE15DF141C11E.description: Demonstrate use and completion of client release forms.

EB3FE04ADCDD491082A614BA871EFABF.description: Explain safety procedures when handling chemical products.

8FA51E967F5B425B88B5923C25BB2821.description: Investigate characteristics, types and effects of chemicals (e.g., pH Scale, acid perm, alkaline perm, exothermic perm and endothermic perms) for a perm service.

54369BAE278A4865BBC1462F2A8F7051.description: Discuss the chemical restructuring of a perm service (e.g. following manufacturer’s instructions, reducing agents, oxidizing agents, test curls, protective barrier creams and blotting techniques).

CF3B35681E414FCD8E465F2F93149467.description: Practice varied wrapping patterns and techniques (e.g., basic straight back wrap, bricklay pattern, double halo, single halo, spiral, piggyback, custom wraps- partial, perimeter, stack and use of varied wrapping tools).

5042B015DC714F639A2ABC3A54A94286.description: Explore the chemical theory and application of permanent waving products and services.

8C99CFDE08324EFB8BB28DF36AE980C8.description: Apply safety and sanitation practices for hair cutting.

A00639CC813B4C1DBF8EB81D02778470.description: Explore online tutorials related to advanced cutting and texturizing or watch a live demonstration from a qualified stylist.

8A5A9E3B2A194D5ABA2E33E13FA4DCBE.description: Discuss how and why advanced techniques are used.

BBA6BC81C45148609859C8458655F2E1.description: Apply advanced hair cutting and texturizing techniques.

9CC6305028BD423E88CEF6DF41D4CAD0.description: Explore and discuss advanced cutting (e.g., blending) and texturizing techniques (e.g., point cutting, slithering, weaving and twist cutting).

1B8014DD5943451BBA679089999ED9BD.description: Apply techniques used in haircutting such as blunt or 0° elevation cutting, crosscheck and 45°/90°/135°/180° elevation cutting.

3FFC65F75681476396AF53F9B70CC60E.description: Research current hair trends and discuss how the elements of art and principles of design apply to each trend.

9A374FDA101D4B94B105C8EE93C537B7.description: Analyze techniques for advanced hair cutting and texturizing.

C0B5B99DAC8C4A4EA61DFBE02E01658B.description: Create decoration or adornments for advanced styles using hairpieces or extensions.

9ABCB99100A147BE9FABFE34273D59AF.description: Implement the elements of art and principles of design to generate a hairstyle from a visual support (e.g., picture, video, technology and social media) or a live demonstration from a qualified professional.

59462DCD010D455E809DF48044901CE0.description: Apply finger waving techniques to create advanced looks or textures.

3E1DFE31FC2F4861927E745CA7BB5E92.description: Critique hair styles created in class using elements of art and principles of design.

2953BDAC9774494A933E563F4F002A68.description: Create hair styles (e.g., braiding, up-do, weaving, knotting, locs, box braids and twists) for a variety of hair textures (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern) and hair characteristics (e.g., elasticity, porosity, density).

F7DF6AC69875415CBDAEE9E50A8A668A.description: Examine how culture, religion and self-identity are expressed through different hairstyles and adornments.

F00895B87DE243C3A2015B9D1DD11BC9.description: Discuss the importance of using appropriate industry terminology when describing hair by referencing texture (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern) and characteristics (e.g., density, elasticity and porosity).

AD3E544AD7144DC08589BAE490573143.description: Analyze how different hairstyles, including all hair textures and hair characteristics, can enhance facial shape and features.

8F1869107FF64AFD9444AAEA25AF435B.description: Create advanced hairstyles for all hair textures and hair characteristics.

1F731D27244A4A139AB4B8ED0E82D95F.description: Discuss and apply safety practises when using all tools and equipment (e.g., adjust hydraulic chairs and other equipment according to stylist’s ergonomic support, use personal protective equipment (PPE), locate first aid and eye wash stations, discard sharps according to regulations and recognize all hazards).

266A58F0B6F84CB79A58261ACCEADE78.description: Describe and perform an inspection process (e.g., check for product build- up and determine when a tool must be removed from service) to maintain manual tools, electric tools and equipment (e.g., remove debris from filters in hairdryers, clippers and clothes dryer and discard refuse and product waste according to regulations).

89A26F0D6F97456EB6936273F218CC54.description: Describe and perform sanitization, sterilization or disinfection of tools and equipment (e.g., spraying disinfectant, wiping and soaking; handling/storing cleaning towels, capes, aprons and smocks).

3CEF5C95800E496D8F025D50A3F9CB11.description: Discuss the importance of sanitation and safety for each tool and piece of equipment used in hairstyling.

34DCE8D7A7604AFDB1E4F4AD8AB16CC5.description: Recognize how proper ergonomic practices are necessary to maintain the health of stylists.

DA844047A6E3470C95D0F8A7E00B4294.description: Demonstrate application of hairstyling manual tools, electric tools and equipment.

99AAE411B4A84550A95AAE7392D8985A.description: Describe how manual tools, electric tools and equipment are used in hairstyling.

DF86C60AFB114F68BB309959E3E2AAF5.description: Identify single-use and multi-use manual tools, styling tools, cutting tools, electric tools, chemical service tools and equipment used in hairstyling.

8C1A2545B695430190ECDA4472DF55D4.description: Examine maintenance and use of hairstyling equipment.

809737CE424543B3BFF70453418CE653.description: Discuss how cultures that have been historically excluded and marginalized are challenging the stereotypical Western ideal of beauty.

E62A587BD41A46B6B4D93AD16AABA9B4.description: Discuss how a traditional Western definition of beauty (e.g., hair texture, light-coloured eyes and skin, hetero normativity) excludes and marginalizes expression of identity and culture.

EEBF805CD0C949658D14DB59FB9F03B2.description: Reflect on personal aesthetic choices (e.g., makeup, hair, nails) and their potential to communicate worldview, culture or self-identity.

445CDA081EC7448DB8436891F25F7958.description: Conduct an inquiry into the question, how does an individual’s expression of human beauty reflect their worldview, culture or self-identity?

7CEB4173D802464DBF30ACF11BC00927.description: Explore ideals of beauty (e.g., size of earlobes, length of hair, piercings, length of nails and gender expression) across cultures.

46A6B318CD9C4278A59F86DB0327CAEE.description: Research and discuss historical and current societal attempts to control (e.g., government regulations/intervention, school dress code) self- expression (e.g., significance of the braid) of beauty.

CE26D2EFDF4444AEA06221C711F7DED0.description: Investigate the impact that worldview and culture have on an individual’s definition of beauty.

A465985FD8CB4023BAB4051B806FEDFF.description: Examine hairstyles, skin care, nail techniques and make-up examples within the local community.

748F5C0669274ABD85F2091015F70981.description: Research how techniques and trends in hairstyling and esthetics reflect worldviews, culture and self-identity.

5A678D77198F43AB92264AA70E3B9ED3.description: Discuss the meaning of worldview, (e.g., attitude and principles) culture (e.g., ethnic background and subculture) and self-identity.

3407C73C354541DA8A6BFB939F3C2E9D.description: Examine how beauty can be an expression of a person’s worldview, culture and self-identity.

22D67A6D65E9428A86D8E36F5A536195.description: Discuss advanced image development strategies used for artistic expression such as exaggeration, layering and simplifying.

BEC99D8D4C7C45CB941A2DBA4CC58662.description: Use advanced colour theory principles and tools to customize hair services to meet individual needs (e.g., warm cool colours, complementary colours, monochromatic analogous and triadic colour schemes).

9F24B4D0A84346F1A94D0FAE30EA676B.description: Critique examples of hair (e.g., renaissance braids, sixties long hair, WWI bobs that were easier to manage, Japanese geisha hairstyles) that were influenced by social, cultural, geographical and environmental contexts.

B4C3E838BEED436CB9A7073070DC41BF.description: Critique examples of hair (e.g., ‘the Rachel’ hairstyle, Elvis Presley’s pompadour, Twiggy’s pixie cut, gender expression) that were influenced by historical art styles or pop culture movements.

157BFE20C5614B1A989FEE2B3F81064E.description: Respond to the inquiry question, how are elements of art and principles of design in hair reflective of time, culture and societal influences?

48A5A55F0AF04E24930960A8A5206D51.description: Respond critically, using appropriate vocabulary, to advanced examples in the context of hair creations considering how the elements of art and principles of design are applied.

94D31DBD06C446409B016134DFB1144F.description: Explore the impact of elements of art and principles of design on hairstyling.

F638EFC2FEEA4B338642B653C8B84705.description: Establish and maintain professional relationships with supervisors/teachers, co-workers and clients.

7DE7ED95FA0D4BE6B2B3273984CAA040.description: Explain the importance of the philosophy, policies and procedures of a salon for technicians and clients.

B4368E7DFA73460FB98DEBAE090A5D0B.description: Critique the impact of cultural proficiency within the hairstyling industry.

6D64020E284F4D08851D9937E73A3FCC.description: Recognize the difference between a chemosterilant and a high level disinfectant.

5791AE48D9204660AFD587C7F14F71E0.description: Investigate different processes for disinfecting, sanitizing and sterilizing non-porous items (e.g., glass, metal, electric files, linen).

A9AD444B3C1B445BB975AD8A1CE07FC0.description: Demonstrate techniques for sanitizing and disinfecting instruments and surfaces.

9488A859F14F4BDCA5A22FA9C50FCAB8.description: Discuss the different levels of disinfection (i.e., high, intermediate and low level) and describe situations when each level is appropriate.

8205AAF9AEC94BC381C754AAC837EAB8.description: Classify single-use implements versus multi-use tools.

923C9B0D8BDC4CDC9D4F732763FF54B1.description: Justify the importance of proper sanitation, disinfection and sterilization.

A683FF932DF44C54A2FD11FA9FF126DD.description: Identify the effects that wellness components such as posture, exercise, rest, stress management, hygiene and nutrition have on the success of a hairstylist or esthetician.

ABF2EE0CDB244BDE8FB9DC46CEE95238.description: Discuss the importance of ergonomics for the health and well-being of technicians.

42E8DF7A8AC64CA0B472F6927EF59028.description: Explain how technician’s choices and behaviours impact safety (e.g., wearing sandals or clothing that exposes skin can cause damage to self or clients).

22276E61AFFA46A38C5FB66284466630.description: Reflect on the impact that salon cleanliness (e.g., dust, organization) has on safety and business feasibility.

49D8BD1D21074D618808867C7C6168E7.description: Brainstorm general safety guidelines for a salon such as managing wires on the floor, extension cords, walkways and handling chemicals.

C0DC44DC9EF2490B9DC4A38436A53535.description: Discuss general safety practices when using common salon equipment.

AF5B4BAE8DD4447C9681B617A54FC5FA.description: Identify potential hazards in salons, appropriate safety equipment (e.g., personal protective equipment (PPE)) and appropriate safety precautions (e.g., public sanitation, trip hazards).

D550BA7A38A049E78FB7B86E931B9CC9.description: Distinguish between provincial and federal health and safety rules and guidelines as applied to hairstyling and esthetics.

7C0A9F8CD19B47F1B864B73392C95351.description: Examine general safety requirements within hairstyling and esthetics.
